intro: Sarcopera, commonly known as the rock fig, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its woody, shrub-like structure. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically thick and leathery, adapted to survive in arid conditions. Sarcopera is often found growing on rocky outcrops and is well-suited to dry, sunny environments.
